ygData.messageBody:
*HUGS*

i feel for you - i'm like that - get attached and such.

heck, i didn't even rp with a guy, we just fought together, he helped me
out, i helped his friends out, and we chatted, when his rl gf found out and
*kaboom!* he disappeard long enough for me to wonder if she a) destroyed his
copy of eq, or b) killed him. hehe.

anyways - don't give up eq. you obviously are one of those people who make
the game worth it for people like me. i hate the powergaming, the camping,
etc. you have a network of friends and "family." like irl, mourn your loss,
but continue on. you have people for support. *smiles*

here - i bestow on you the highest honour i can give (you have to see my
char's sig to fully understand but...)

*SMOOGLES*

lol

anerak
cleric of 15 shots in the @$$
hero's of norrath
e'ci

lynnara starspinner
bard of 25 shatterd glasses
lion's share
e'ci




Message: 2
> Date: Tue, 11 Jul 2000 11:47:54 -0700
> From: "Judy Tyrer" <judy3t@...>
>Subject: If it's just a game, why does it hurt so much?
>
>First of all I'm irate at Verant. Apparently they not only keep text logs
of all text in the game, they allow these logs outside the company (or, at
least ONE employee has distributed them).
>
>I have been playing an in-game love story for about the last 4-5 months.
I'm married and he has a serious, though out of town, girlfriend. It is
purely fantasy RP. But it's fun. Well, apparently his RL GF has a friend
at Verant who gave her access to all the text files that he has generated -
i.e., she has read large quantities of his private conversations.
>
>Bottom line is that she sees me as a threat and so the in-game
romance/relationship is off. I can't fault him for caring more for his real
life girlfriend. But it leaves me with this huge empty hole inside. It is
the RP aspect of EQ that I enjoy the most. Cute little wood elf druid in
love with adorable half elf ranger. We ran our guild together. We had a
full blown fantasy and it's gone and I don't want it to be. I have no
choice. But Norrath is filled with memories that now feel sort of sour.
After all, we were planning our in-game wedding!
>
>This is not the first RP relationship I've had. It's the third with the
first ending on a good, though sad, note when he left because he had pulled
his life together. The second one I ended because I didn't like the way I
was treated - my player feelings being subjugated to the RP for the sake of
the RP. And now this.
>
>What's sad is that if anything I help her since I know this man's
idiosyncracies and come down on him for some of them. In fact, I had told
him something in our relationship which he took into theirs and it made him
more attentive to her needs and less self-absorbed in his own thoughts. He
told me about it.
>
>Anyway, I'm not going to change the current situation. He has to do what
he feels necessary and right, wrong, or indifferent she feels threatened by
his having a relationship in-game. I'll still be his friend, but playing
together isn't going to work out the same.
>
>My husband had the best response. "You need a new game. Too bad there
aren't any out there". I tried Diablo 2 and blech. To me EQ is all about
the people and it is the people that I enjoy.
>
>So I am sitting here wondering if I have what it takes to try again. I
know at least four players who were more than thrilled to lend me a shoulder
to cry on. I am well loved in the game and that's nice. I'm sure I could
build a new romance. I'm just wondering if it's worth it emotionally.
>
>I get attached to my characters (when I played with my first partner I
would cry when he decided he didn't want to play a character anymore and
even though it was the same partner, the loss of that character hurt ). I
cry at sad movies. I cry at the end of good books. That kind of attachment
to characters is part of who I am and I wouldn't want to change it.
>
>But my heart has gone out of the game with this. I'm scheduled for a raid
tonight and they are voting on my membership in a new guild this week and I
don't want to shoot myself in the foot by just stopping right now. He's
sorting out where he feels the boundaries are since he wants our friendship
(we both do) but isn't sure what violates his promise to his GF and what
doesn't.
>
>Anyway, I'm just trying to sort through what is healthy and not healthy for
me wrt to EQ now. I'm happily married for 15 years and have 2 kids and
that's what MATTERS. But I've always had an active fantasy life and having
people to populate it with thier own independent input has just been a
delight. But Norrath is transient and people come and people go. And each
loss hurts. Some more than others. Each is the loss of a friend (Brell
isn't the same without Luna, for example).
>
>Anyway, insights and perspective are welcome.
>
>Ice
